file_content.text: I'm so proud, I think you actually brought a tear to my eye.
Quite the looker, that one... I hate it when they know it.
When do I get my turn?
I like that kid. Reminds me of me, only uglier.
The old man's a bit stingy, but it was easy enough money, right?
If I'd known the Organas could put up such a fight, I'd have said take the deal.
I love negotiating with the upper hand. Let's get him back before he starts to smell.
I never really had any stomach for the Organas. Too straight and narrow for my taste.
Excellent timing, that one. Let's get going; it'll be a long walk.
Next time you're going to tell off someone who's set an obvious trap, take Mako.
I can't feel my face. Tell me you brought a medpac.
I guess you made a good impression. The Rists aren't the sort for negotiating.
Well, he's not here. How about we just turn around?
I've heard of Rist, absolutely ruthless and unbelievably deadly. I'd stay behind you, but that's the direction they'll be coming.
Have a nice walk? I had a lovely tour of my own.
I think she's warming up to you, keep at it.
I hadn't realized the Alderaanians started keeping their livestock indoors.
I guess that confirms that you aren't in this business for the money.
Old guy can't remember everything that's in here... oh, nothing.
Royal Museum... that sounds promising.
That's enough playing bagman for the day, yes?
Lord Malfus is a popular fellow.
It really doesn't pay to be hired help.
He calls these bribes? I wouldn't get out of bed for half of this.
Here's the plan: You write the will, I'll forge the signature.
That man's got ambitions. Could be worth talking to him.
This is going to be messy. Just smile and bite your tongue. A lot.
Never been to House Thul. I think they were still in exile the times I've been here.
